classitems.description:
This is the constructor for new PointerEvents.

New Pointer Events must be given a type, and an optional dictionary of
initialization properties.

Due to certain platform requirements, events returned from the constructor
identify as MouseEvents.

params.name: inType
params.description: The type of the event to create.

params.name: inDict
params.description: An optional dictionary of initial event properties.

return.description: A new PointerEvent of type `inType` and initialized with properties from `inDict`.

classitems.description: This module implements an map of pointer states

This module is for normalizing events. Mouse and Touch events will be
collected here, and fire PointerEvents that have the same semantics, no
matter the source.
Events fired:
  - pointerdown: a pointing is added
  - pointerup: a pointer is removed
  - pointermove: a pointer is moved
  - pointerover: a pointer crosses into an element
  - pointerout: a pointer leaves an element
  - pointercancel: a pointer will no longer generate events

Add a new event source that will generate pointer events.

`inSource` must contain an array of event names named `events`, and
functions with the names specified in the `events` array.

params.name: name
params.description: A name for the event source

params.name: source
params.description: A new source of platform events.

classitems.description:
Creates a new Event of type `inType`, based on the information in
`inEvent`.

params.name: inType
params.description: A string representing the type of event to create

params.name: inEvent
params.description: A platform event with a target

classitems.description: Returns a snapshot of inEvent, with writable properties.

params.name: inEvent
params.description: An event that contains properties to copy.

return.description:
An object containing shallow copies of `inEvent`'s
   properties.

classitems.description: Dispatches the event to its target.

return.description: True if an event handler returns true, false otherwise.

classitems.description:
This module uses Mutation Observers to dynamically adjust which nodes will
generate Pointer Events.

All nodes that wish to generate Pointer Events must have the attribute
`touch-action` set to `none`.

This module contains the handlers for native platform events.
From here, the dispatcher is called to create unified pointer events.
Included are touch events (v1), mouse events, and MSPointerEvents.
